name: Janet Rockwell
descriptions: Janet Rockwell is the wife of Roger Rockwell, living in Tranquility Lane in Fallout 3.

Janet is one of Vault 112's inhabitants, trapped in Tranquility Lane alongside her husband, Roger. She has an affinity for baking and gardening, as well as caring for her appearance with occasional trips to the salon.
She has a dislike for Mabel Henderson, stemming from her being "a little too nosey" and questioning if the Lone Wanderer has been asked to pry into her marriage per Mabel's request;

In reality, she is stuck in the Tranquility Lounger at Vault 112, as resident 115, with elevated stress levels: 87 bpm, 140/85 mmHg of blood pressure, 98.2°F/36.7°C temperature, and 18 breaths per minute, similar to Timmy Neusbaum and Martha Simpson.

When looking at resident IDs, Roger Rockwell and Martha Simpson have adjacent IDs (226 and 227 respectively), while Janet Simpson has the ID 115. As such, it's entirely possible that Rockwell and Simpson were originally a couple, rather than Janet.

topics.response_text: How could Roger accuse me of something like that? What is wrong with him?

topics.topic_text: It's your basement, lady. You tell me.
topics.response_text: This isn't mine. Why would Roger have this down here?

topics.topic_text: I hate to break it to you, but I saw your husband kissing some other woman.
topics.response_text: It's that Martha Simpson, isn't it? I knew it! That's it. I've had enough of Roger's lies and bullshit!

topics.topic_text: Well, then I guess he's cheating on you.
topics.response_text: My God... I knew it. I knew it!{furious}

topics.topic_text: It looks like Roger is a fan of women's clothing.
topics.response_text: But... This isn't mine. What is this doing here?
What is this doing here?{angry, horrified}

topics.topic_text: Maybe it's his. You know, for him to wear when no one is looking...
topics.response_text: Oh my God. Roger... He wouldn't. But...{shocked, horrified}

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the neighborhood?
topics.response_text: Roger suggested we move here... I don't quite remember when that was...
Your dad? No, I haven't. I'm sure he's around here somewhere.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Mabel Henderson?
topics.response_text: Roger and I don't spend much time with Mabel, frankly. She's a little nosey for my tastes. And I don't like visiting her house, either.

topics.topic: MQ04ResidentRockwellsCan you tell me anything about the Rockwells' marriage?
topics.topic_text: Anything you want to tell me about your marriage?
topics.response_text: Our marriage? Goodness, what kind of a question is that?

topics.topic: MQ04ResidentSimulationThis is a pretty convincing simulation...
topics.topic_text: None of this is real. It's all some crazy experiment.
topics.response_text: Oh, you're such a kidder.{amused, dismissive}

topics.topic_text: You'd better come down to the basement. There's something you need to see...
topics.response_text: What were you doing in our basement? What's down there?

topics.topic_text: Betty wants me to break up your marriage.
topics.response_text: What? Now that's a ridiculous thing to say. You kids need to find some different games to play!
What a horrible thing to say! Is that your idea of a joke?{shocked, horrified}

conversation.response_text: What's this... Women's clothing? Down here?{confused, apprehensive}
You fucking coward. I can't stand the sight of you. Get away from me!
The hell with working this out. I'm sick of you. I'm staying at Mabel's tonight. Don't talk to me. Don't even look at me.
You pervert! You disgust me! Just stay away from me!
What are you talking about? I haven't done anything...{frightened}
Should I invite the Neusbaums over for Bridge, or will you be down in the basement all night again?
How could you... Roger, no. This is not the time for that discussion. Please.{exasperated}
